pkgmetadata.longdescription: FontForge -- An outline font editor that lets you create your own postscript, truetype, opentype, cid-keyed, multi-master, cff, svg and bitmap (bdf, FON, NFNT) fonts, or edit existing ones. Also lets you convert one format to another. FontForge has support for many macintosh font formats.

use.flag: Build in support for type3/svg fonts containing multilayered drawing with strokes, fills, images, etc. Type3 fonts are only supported by postscript printers (not by most windowing displays). They are capable of more exotic images than normal fonts but require much more effort to support.
Controls whether fontforge has a paste after command (Useful for making words?). This is kind of fun, but it isn't useful for normal fonts.
Controls whether fontforge understands the gb12345 encoding and installs cidmap package to edit CID-keyed fonts
Controls whether fontforge has a tile path command (a variant of expand stroke) This is useful for very decorative fonts, most people won't want it.
